bibl.title: Petitioner v. Defendant. Type of document
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: In the matter of the application of F Fetter for a writ of Habeues Corpus

And now the sheriff having made due to the writ above herein and having prodcued into Court the minor child susannah fetter as by said writ ordered and the petitioner F Fetter appearing by his Counsel Mix & Mullen and Lena Feller the wife of the petitioner appearing by Counsel F T Dryer and resisting the application of petitioner for the Custody of said minor child and examination of and agreement of Counsel it appearing to the Court that the petitioner and the said Lena Feller are legally married and that the minor child Susannah Feller is the fruit of said marriage and that Maria Feller a minor child is also the fruit of said marraige and it further appearing that the F Feller and Lena Feller his wife have seperated and that the said F Feller has instituited a suit for divorce which will come as heard on the 30th of June ad 1869 and whereas any order now made in reference to the custody of said minor child Susannah Fetter would only be temporary
and be said hearing and Whearas this Court is empowered Is made the temporary order for the custody of minor children during the pending of divorce petitons in view the it is here

Considered & ajudged That the minor children the fruits of said marraige to wit Susannah and Maria Fetter be committed to the Custody of the "Sisters of Charity" of Walla Walla county by them kept until the hearing of said petition for divorce until the right of both parents to have a case to said children at all suitable times and conformable to any said sisters may have or may adopt in the premises and it is further ordered that the sherrif deliever said children to the said "sisters" and that they be kept undercared for by said "sisters" at the expense of the petitioner F Fetter and it is further adjudged that
I hereby certify that I have executed the within warrant of arrest by arresting the within named Susan Fetter who I found in the custody of Mrs. Lena Fetter at Wallula for Portland Oregon and have her now in my posession
Subject to the order of the court
Walla Walla May 287869 Jas McAuliff Sheriff
Warrant for arrest of Susannah Fetter, under Writ of Habeas Corpus,
In the District Court for the First Judicial District for the Territory of Washington the Territory of Washington to James McAuliff Sherrif of Walla Walla County

Whereas an affidavit hath this day been made before me by J. Fetter the lawful guardian father of Susannah Fetter setting forth that over Eugene Crowne & L Fetter unlawfully restrained said Susannah Fetter a minor child of her liberty and are about to transport the said Susannah Fetter beyond the jurisdiction of this court before process case served on E Crowne & L Fetter – Now therfore James McCauliff Sherrif of the County of Walla Walla
are hereby commanded fourth with to arrest the said Susannah Fetter and bring her before the Hon. J E judge dist court 1 st jud dis w. t. chambers there to be dealt with according to law
In Witness whereof I have hereunto set my hand and affixed the official Seal of said Court this the 27th day of May AD 1869.
B.B. Wayeho Clerk of the District Court of the First Judicial Distict of Washington Territory.
In the matter of the petition of F. Fetter
F P Dugan attorney for E Crowne

Comes now forth P Dugan specially appearing for - E Crowne and moves the Court to dismiss the petition of said F Fetter because no service has been made on the said E Crowne hear in P Dugan special atty for E. Crowne
In the matter of Petition of F Fetter
Territory of Washington County of Walla Walla }SS
Lena Fetter being first duly sworn says she knows the contents of the foregoing answer and that the same is true as she verily believes L Fetter

Subscribed and sworn to before me this day of May 1869
Notary Public
